ygData.subject: Re: 256k Magix + EverQuest = Low Lag ??? Please comment!
ygData.msgSnippet: Cable is prolly slightly better. Morning to Evening ping is abt 180-250 with a pl of 0-10% but as it gets later,it gets worse however the worst Ive gotten this
ygData.messageBody:
Cable is prolly slightly better.
Morning to Evening ping is abt 180-250 with a pl of 0-10% but as it gets
later,it gets worse however the worst Ive gotten this past few weeks is
600+ping 30%pl..thats at about 11pm.

The ping starts to get higher after 6pm all the way to the laggiest point at
11pm however this does not occur that often.Usually during weekends =)

This is according to the Lans Vytl,Prexus Server

Regards
Hevan
Servant of Mithaniel Marr
-----Original Message-----
From: Terence Tan <kctan@...>
To: sg-everquest@onelist.com <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, January 27, 2000 1:24 PM
Subject: [sg-everquest] 256k Magix + EverQuest = Low Lag ??? Please comment!


>From: "Terence Tan" <kctan@...>
>
>
>
>Who is using Magix to play EverQuest? Care to share ur experience with us?
Have
>any of u experience bad lag?
>
>My ping/lag used to be very good until 2 days ago. Since then, everyday I
went
>home from work (around 8pm) and log into EQ, my lag meter show constant 60%
>packet lost for incoming and outgoing data. The strange thing is my ping is
VERY
>good, it's around 200-300 constantly for incoming and outgoing data.
Because of
>the huge packet lost, I was not able to enjoy the game. But things started
to
>get better at around 10:45pm, my ping remains the same and my packet lost
drop
>till less than 10% for incoming and outgoing.
>
>What is wrong with Magix? Should I switch to cable? Cable user pls comment.
>
>
